alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 4:43PM AKST until February 16 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 10 inches along with blowing snow. Ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow may reduce visibilities to one half mile or less at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snow accumulations are expected to extend approximately from Chefornak to Lower Kalskag, with the heaviest snowfall occurring early Wednesday morning. Freezing rain, at times mixed with snow, is expected west of the Kuskokwim Mountains from the Kuskokwim Bay to Tuluksak. Any freezing rain should transition to snow by early Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
